channel.title: Help with offline server
channel.description:
Edit: Solved
I'm having trouble getting my offline server to connect to my localhost.. Everytime I connect, it goes to my online server...
I changed the ip in config.java to localhost and compiled.. Is there something I'm missing?
and my world file...
[code]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?> <!DOCTYPE properties SYSTEM "http://java.sun.com/dtd/properties.dtd"> <properties> <comment>RSCD Config</comment> <entry key="version">39</entry> <entry key="ip">132.47.64.85</entry> <entry key="port">43594</entry> <entry key="name">RSC</entry> <entry key="location">USA</entry> <entry key="maxplayers">800</entry> <entry key="servernum">3</entry> <entry key="lsip">localhost</entry> <entry key="lsport">34526</entry> <entry key="mysqluser">root1</entry> <entry key="mysqlpass"></entry> <entry key="mysqlhost">localhost</entry> </properties>[/code]

item.title: Help with offline server

@A_Gh0st wrote:

item.title: Help with offline server
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“cleako, post:11, topic:419020”]You appear to still be using your external IP address for the world server. Use the internal.

Providing your client is set to connect to localhost, it should work correctly.[/quote]
And that lolol, I thought you meant something different + i never looked at your code :L.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with offline server
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

You appear to still be using your external IP address for the world server. Use the internal.

Providing your client is set to connect to localhost, it should work correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with offline server
item.dc:creator: @A_Gh0st A Gh0st
item.description:
@A_Gh0st wrote:

Well now I can’t connect to any server… ugh…

[code]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>

RSCD Config 39 152.44.20.20 5555 RSCEvolution USA 800 3 localhost 34526 root1 localhost [/code]

public class Config { public static String SERVER_IP = "152.44.24.25", CONF_DIR = "", MEDIA_DIR = ""; public static int SERVER_PORT = 5555, MOVIE_FPS = 5;

connects to nothing now…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with offline server
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“A Gh0st, post:7, topic:419020”][quote author=Kidpaparoach link=topic=521549.msg3790141#msg3790141 date=1319233807]
I don’t even get a thankyou
[/quote]
It’s because I don’t really understand… change the lsport or “port” … and what port do i change it to anyways?[/quote]
Could’ve said you don’t.
Most server’s default port they run on is 43594. So search your source and client and change them to a different one. It doesn’t matter what one as long as there the same port. I run my server on port 5555 personally.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with offline server
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

You need to set that to your internal IP or also set it to bind to localhost.

You can find your internal IP via going to command prompt and typing “ipconfig”

Scroll up until you see the entry for your ethernet connection.

Windows IP Configuration


Ethernet adapter Local Area Connection 2:

   Connection-specific DNS Suffix  . :
   Link-local IPv6 Address . . . . . : fe80::e939:2afc:a74f:35ed%13
   IPv4 Address. . . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.0.15
   Subnet Mask . . . . . . . . . . . : 255.255.255.0
   Default Gateway . . . . . . . . . : 192.168.0.1

You want to put what it reads for IPv4 Address.

Read full topic

Edit: Solved

I’m having trouble getting my offline server to connect to my localhost… Everytime I connect, it goes to my online server…

and my world file…

[code]<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>

RSCD Config 39 132.47.64.85 43594 RSC USA 800 3 localhost 34526 root1 localhost [/code]
